description: From Middle French risible and directly from Late Latin rīsibilis, from Latin rīsus (“laughter”) + -ibilis, from the perfect passive participle of rīdeō (“laugh”).

adjectives.description: risible (comparative more risible, superlative most risible)

entries.meaning: Provoking laughter; ludicrous; ridiculous; humorously insignificant
(of a person) Easily laughing; prone to laughter
examples: She was half risible, half concerned.
